title: Leonardo DiCaprio keeps a low profile while seen with his dad George leaving lunch in Beverly Hills
text:
He's a world famous movie star well known for keeping quite a low profile.

Academy Award-winning actor Leonardo DiCaprio was spotted in Los Angeles, California on Thursday, departing a lunch meeting with his father George and a friend in Beverly Hills.

The Titanic actor, 44, was seen saying goodbye after lunch, holding a Fiat shopping bag.

Dad and son: Leonardo DiCaprio was spotted in Los Angeles on Thursday, departing a lunch meeting with his father George (left) and a friend in Beverly Hills

True to form, DiCaprio wore a very inconspicuous ensemble, consisting of a grey-green t-shirt, dark jeans, and a heather hoodie tied round his waist.

Leo covered up with a black Yankees baseball cap, and sunshades.

He wore bright white sneakers.

His father George, a well-known writer-editor and performance artist, shook hands with their friend as they parted ways.

Goodbyes: True to form, DiCaprio wore a very inconspicuous ensemble, consisting of a grey-green t-shirt and dark jeans

Low profile: Leo covered up with a black Yankees baseball cap and sunshades

Earlier in the day, DiCaprio, who is in a relationship with 22-year-old Argentine model girlfriend Camila Morrone, was seen leaving an LA area hotel.

Leo is coming off a successful summer in which he headlined Quentin Tarantino's well-received ninth feature, Once Upon A Time In Hollywood.

Stepping out: Earlier in the day, DiCaprio was seen leaving an LA hotel

Low key: Leonardo donned sunglasses and a baseball cap while stepping out

He has four upcoming projects in some phase of development, including crime drama The Black Hand and Martin Scorsese's next film, period piece Killers Of The Flower Moon.

DiCaprio is also attached to two other Scorsese titles, including a TV series called The Devil In The White City as well as a biopic in which he will portray Theodore Roosevelt.

In 2016, Leo won a Best Actor Oscar for his leading role in Alejandro G. Iñárritu's The Revenant, after being nominated for his acting work a previous four times.
